typeSettings.formulaText: ({{@Scrape Company Posts}}?.data || []).filter(p => moment().diff(moment(p?.created_at), "days") <= 30).map((p, i) => "POST " + (i+1) + " [" + moment(p?.created_at).format("YYYY-MM-DD") + "]: " + (p?.title || "").slice(0, 500)).join("\n---\n") || "No recent posts"
typeSettings.formulaPrompt: Filter scraped posts to last 30 days using moment.js, format as readable text with date and content

inputsBinding.name: prompt
inputsBinding.formulaText:
"Analyze these recent LinkedIn posts from " + Clay.formatForAIPrompt({{@Company Name}}) + " for buying triggers relevant to Mos Health, a B2B workplace wellness company selling clinical-grade supplements and AI health guidance at $95/employee/month to in-office US companies (50-500 employees).

" + Clay.formatForAIPrompt({{@Posts Last 30 Days}}) + "

Buying triggers to detect:

1. **Major Product Release** — A significant new product launch, major platform overhaul, or game-changing feature. NOT minor patches, bug fixes, incremental updates, or routine feature announcements. Must be a big deal.

2. **Company News** — Funding round, acquisition, office expansion, new office opening, new C-level or VP hire, major partnership, IPO signals, rapid headcount growth.

3. **Culture & Wellness** — Employee wellness programs, office perks or benefits, team culture celebrations, return-to-office announcements, workplace health initiatives, employee engagement events, office redesigns, new office openings.

Rules:
- Be selective. Only flag genuine buying signals, not routine marketing or thought leadership content.
- Product releases must be MAJOR (new product line, v2 launch, platform pivot) to qualify.
- Company news must indicate growth or change that creates budget or attention for employee wellness.
- Culture posts must show the company actively invests in employee experience.
- If no posts match any trigger, set hasTrigger to false and triggerType to None."

typeSettings.formulaText: ({{@Search HubSpot Contacts}}?.results || []).map((c, i) => (i+1) + ". " + (c?.properties?.firstname || "") + " " + (c?.properties?.lastname || "") + " | " + (c?.properties?.jobtitle || "N/A") + " | " + (c?.properties?.email || "no email")).join("\n") || "No contacts found"

inputsBinding.name: prompt
inputsBinding.formulaText:
"Based on a buying trigger and HubSpot contacts, recommend who Mos Health should reach out to.

Company: " + Clay.formatForAIPrompt({{@Company Name}}) + "
Buying Trigger: " + Clay.formatForAIPrompt({{@Trigger Type}}) + " — " + Clay.formatForAIPrompt({{@Trigger Summary}}) + "

HubSpot Contacts:
" + Clay.formatForAIPrompt({{@HubSpot Contacts List}}) + "

About Mos Health:
- Clinical-grade workplace supplements + AI health guidance
- $95/employee/month, includes +1 family member
- ICP: In-office US companies, 50-500 employees, Series A-C
- Value prop: Reduce sick days, boost retention, measurable ROI on employee health

Target personas (priority order):
1. HR / People / Benefits leaders — own employee wellness budget
2. CEO / Founder / COO — at smaller companies, make benefits decisions directly
3. Office Manager / Workplace / Facilities — manage physical office experience
4. Chief of Staff / EA — gatekeepers, influence perks decisions

Pick the single best contact from the HubSpot list. Write a specific outreach angle that connects the buying trigger to why Mos Health matters for them RIGHT NOW.
If no good contact exists, set noIdealContact to true and put the ideal role to find in recommendedContactTitle."
